intro: Stylidium cymiferum, commonly known as the clustered triggerplant, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking, red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a unique structure with a short, stout stem and a cluster of leaves at the base. Its flowers are spurred and have a distinctive trigger-like mechanism that aids in pollination by attracting specific insects. Stylidium cymiferum is often found in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats.
